name: abbr
description: An abbreviated description of the header cell's content.

name: accept
description: List of types the server accepts, typically a file type.

predefinedValues.description: Any audio file.
Any video file.
Any image file.
Generic text file
Generic binary file

name: accept-charset
description: List of supported charsets.

predefinedValues.description: Unicode Transformation Format - 8-bit.
Western European, Latin-1.
Unicode Transformation Format - 16-bit.
American Standard Code for Information Interchange.

name: accesskey
description: Keyboard shortcut to activate or add focus to the element.

name: action
description: The URI of a program that processes the information submitted via the form.

name: allow
description: Specifies a feature-policy for the iframe.

name: allowfullscreen
description: Allow the iframe to be fullscreen.

name: alt
description: Alternative text in case an image can't be displayed.

name: as
description: Specifies the type of content being loaded by the link.

predefinedValues.description: The linked resource is an audio file.
The linked resource is a document.
The linked resource is an embeddable plugin.
The linked resource is a fetch script.
The linked resource is a font.
The linked resource is an image.
The linked resource is an object.
The linked resource is a script.
The linked resource is a stylesheet.
The linked resource is a track.
The linked resource is a video.
The linked resource is a worker.

name: async
description: Executes the script asynchronously.

name: autocapitalize
description: Sets whether input is automatically capitalized when entered by user.

predefinedValues.description: No autocapitalization.
No autocapitalization.
Autocapitalize the first letter of each word.
Autocapitalize the first letter of each sentence.
Autocapitalize the first letter of each word.
Autocapitalize all characters.

name: autofocus
description: Automatically focus the form control when the page is loaded.

name: autocomplete

predefinedValues.description: The browser is not allowed to automatically complete the input.
The browser is allowed to automatically complete the input.

description: Indicates whether controls in this form can by default have their values automatically completed by the browser.

name: autoplay
description: The audio or video should play as soon as possible.

name: blocking
description: Indicates the resource is a blocking resource.

predefinedValues.description: The resource is a render-blocking resource.

name: capture
description: Specifies a new file should be captured and which device should be used.

predefinedValues.description: The user-facing camera and/or microphone should be used.
The outward-facing camera and/or microphone should be used.

name: charset
description: Declares the character encoding of the page or script.

predefinedValues.description: Unicode Transformation Format - 8-bit.
Western European, Latin-1.
Unicode Transformation Format - 16-bit.
American Standard Code for Information Interchange.

name: checked
description: Indicates whether the element should be checked on page load.

name: cite
description: Contains a URI which points to the source of the quote or change.

name: class
description: Often used with CSS to style elements with common properties.

name: cols
description: Defines the number of columns in a textarea.

name: colspan
description: The colspan attribute defines the number of columns a cell should span.

name: content
description: A value associated with http-equiv or name depending on the context.

name: contenteditable
description: Indicates whether the element's content is editable.

predefinedValues.description: The element is editable.
The element is not editable.
The element is editable, but only plain text.

name: controls
description: Indicates whether the browser should show playback controls to the user.

name: controlslist
description: Defines the controls that should be displayed.

name: coords
description: A set of values specifying the coordinates of the hot-spot region.

name: crossorigin
description: How the element handles cross-origin requests.

predefinedValues.description: A cross-origin request (i.e., with no credentials).
A cross-origin request with credentials.

name: data
description: Specifies the URL of the resource.

name: data-*
description: Lets you attach custom attributes to an HTML element.

name: datetime
description: Indicates the date and time associated with the element.

name: decoding
description: Indicates the preferred method to decode the image.

predefinedValues.description: Decode the image synchronously.
Decode the image asynchronously.
Let the browser decide.

name: default
description: Indicates that the track should be enabled unless the user's preferences indicate something different.

name: defer
description: Indicates that the script should be executed after the page has been parsed.

name: dir
description: Defines the text direction. Allowed values are ltr (left-to-right) or rtl (right-to-left).

predefinedValues.description: Left to right.
Right to left.
Let the browser decide.

name: dirname
description: The dirname attribute on a form control element enables the submission of the element's directionality in form submission.

name: disabled
description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the element.

name: disablepictureinpicture
description: Disable Picture-in-Picture mode.

name: disableremoteplayback
description: Disable remote playback.

name: download
description: Indicates that the hyperlink is to be used for downloading a resource.

name: draggable
description: Defines whether the element can be dragged.

predefinedValues.description: The element is draggable.
The element is not draggable.

name: elementtiming
description: Specifies the element timing attribute.

name: enctype
description: Defines the content type of the form data when the method is POST.

predefinedValues.description: The default value. All characters are encoded before sent (spaces are converted to "+" symbols, and special characters are converted to ASCII HEX values).
No characters are encoded. This value is required when you are using forms that have a file upload control.
Useful for debugging. Spaces are converted to "+" symbols, but no special characters are encoded.

name: enterkeyhint
description: The enterkeyhint specifies what action label (or icon) to present for the enter key on virtual keyboards. The attribute can be used with form controls (such as the value of textarea elements), or in elements in an editing host (e.g., using contenteditable attribute).

predefinedValues.description: The enter key is used to accept the input.
The enter key is used to indicate that the input is done and should be submitted.
The enter key is used to indicate that the input is complete and should be submitted.
The enter key is used to move to the next step in the input process.
The enter key is used to move to the previous step in the input process.
The enter key is used to perform a search operation.
The enter key is used to send the input.

name: exportparts
description: Defines the element's export parts.

name: fetchpriority
description: Specifies the fetch priority attribute.

predefinedValues.description: The browser is allowed to decide the priority.
The resource should be fetched with high priority.
The resource should be fetched with low priority.

name: for
description: Describes elements which belongs to this one.

name: form
description: Indicates the form that is the owner of the element.

name: formaction
description: Indicates the action of the element, overriding the action defined in the <form>.

name: formenctype
description: If the button/input is a submit button (e.g. type="submit"), this attribute sets the encoding type to use during form submission. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the enctype attribute of the button's form owner.

predefinedValues.description: The default value. All characters are encoded before sent (spaces are converted to "+" symbols, and special characters are converted to ASCII HEX values).
No characters are encoded. This value is required when you are using forms that have a file upload control.
Useful for debugging. Spaces are converted to "+" symbols, but no special characters are encoded.

name: formmethod
description: If the button/input is a submit button (e.g. type="submit"), this attribute sets the submission method to use during form submission (GET, POST, etc.). If this attribute is specified, it overrides the method attribute of the button's form owner.

predefinedValues.description: Submits the form data as part of the URL.
Submits the form data as part of the request body.
Opens a dialog box for the user to save the form data.

name: formnovalidate
description: If the button/input is a submit button (e.g. type="submit"), this boolean attribute specifies that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the novalidate attribute of the button's form owner.

name: formtarget
description: If the button/input is a submit button (e.g. type="submit"), this attribute specifies the browsing context (for example, tab, window, or inline frame) in which to display the response that is received after submitting the form. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the target attribute of the button's form owner.

predefinedValues.description: The response is displayed in the same frame.
The response is displayed in a new window or tab.
The response is displayed in the parent frame.
The response is displayed in the full body of the window.

name: headers
description: IDs of the <th> elements which applies to this element.

name: height
description: Specifies the height of elements listed here. For all other elements, use the CSS height property.

name: hidden
description: Prevents rendering of given element, while keeping child elements, e.g. script elements, active.

predefinedValues.description: The element is not displayed.
The element is not displayed.

name: high
description: Indicates the lower bound of the upper range.

name: href
description: The URL of a linked resource.

name: hreflang
description: Specifies the language of the linked resource.

name: http-equiv
description: Defines a pragma directive.

predefinedValues.description: Defines a content policy for the document.
Gives the value in the Content-Type HTTP header.
Specifies the preferred stylesheet to use.
Specifies a delay before the browser automatically reloads the page.

name: id
description: Often used with CSS to style a specific element. The value of this attribute must be unique.

name: imagesizes
description: Specifies the sizes of the linked resource.

name: imagesrcset
description: Specifies the URL of the image to use in the link.

name: inert
description: Indicates that the element is not interactive.

name: integrity
description: Specifies a Subresource Integrity value that allows browsers to verify what they fetch.

name: inputmode
description: Provides a hint as to the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. The attribute can be used with form controls (such as the value of textarea elements), or in elements in an editing host (e.g., using contenteditable attribute).

predefinedValues.description: No virtual keyboard.
Text input. (Default)
Decimal input.
Numeric input.
Telephone input.
Search input.
Email input.
URL input.

name: is
description: Used to specify the standard HTML element should behave like a custom element.

name: ismap
description: Indicates that the image is part of a server-side image map.

name: itemid
description: Global attribute that is used to uniquely identify an item.

name: itemprop
description: Used to add properties to an item.

name: itemref
description: Provides a list of element IDs that are referenced by the item.

name: itemscope
description: Indicates that the element and its children is about a particular item.

name: itemtype
description: Specifies the URL of the vocabulary that will be used to define the item.

name: kind
description: Specifies the kind of text track.

predefinedValues.description: Subtitles provide translation of content that cannot be understood by the viewer.
Captions provide a transcription of audio content.
Descriptions provide a textual description of the video content.
Chapters provide chapter titles for the video.
Metadata tracks contain metadata.

name: label
description: Specifies a user-readable title of the element.

name: lang
description: Defines the language used in the element.

name: loading
description: Indicates if the element should be loaded lazily (loading="lazy") or loaded immediately (loading="eager").

predefinedValues.description: Defer loading of the resource until it reaches a calculated distance from the viewport.
Load the resource immediately.

name: list
description: Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.

name: loop
description: Indicates whether the media should start playing from the start when it's finished.

name: low
description: Indicates the upper bound of the lower range.

name: max
description: Indicates the maximum value allowed.

name: maxlength
description: Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in the element.

name: media
description: Specifies a hint of the media for which the linked resource was designed.

name: method
description: Defines which HTTP method to use when submitting the form. Can be GET (default) or POST.

predefinedValues.description: Submits the form data as part of the URL.
Submits the form data as part of the request body.
Opens a dialog box for the user to save the form data.

name: min
description: Indicates the minimum value allowed.

name: minlength
description: Defines the minimum number of characters allowed in the element.

name: multiple
description: Indicates whether multiple values can be entered in an input of the type email or file.

name: muted
description: Indicates whether the audio will be initially silenced on page load.

name: name
description: Name of the element. For example used by the server to identify the fields in form submits.

name: nomodule
description: Indicates that the script should not be executed in browsers that support ES modules.

name: nonce
description: Defines a cryptographic nonce ("number used once")

name: novalidate
description: This attribute indicates that the form shouldn't be validated when submitted.

name: open
description: Indicates whether the contents are currently visible (in the case of a <details> element) or whether the dialog is active and can be interacted with (in the case of a <dialog> element).

name: optimum
description: Indicates the optimal numeric value.

name: pattern
description: Defines a regular expression which the element's value will be validated against.

name: part
description: Contains a space-separated list of the part names of the element

name: ping
description: The ping attribute specifies a space-separated list of URLs to be notified if a user follows the hyperlink.

name: placeholder
description: Provides a hint to the user of what can be entered in the field.

name: playsinline
description: A Boolean attribute indicating that the video is to be played "inline"; that is, within the element's playback area. Note that the absence of this attribute does not imply that the video will always be played in fullscreen.

name: poster
description: A URL indicating a poster frame to show until the user plays or seeks.

name: popover
description: Represents a popover.

name: popovertarget
description: Turns a button element into a popover control button.

name: popovertargetaction
description: Specifies the action to be performed on a popover element being controlled by a control button.

name: preload
description: Indicates whether the whole resource, parts of it or nothing should be preloaded.

predefinedValues.description: Do not preload any data.
Preload only metadata.
Preload the entire resource.

name: readonly
description: Indicates whether the element can be edited.

name: referrerpolicy
description: Specifies which referrer is sent when fetching the resource.

predefinedValues.description: The referrer information will not be sent.
The referrer information will not be sent when navigating from HTTPS to HTTP.
Only send the origin (scheme, host, and port) as the referrer.
Send the origin as the referrer when the destination is a different origin.
Send the full URL as the referrer when the destination is the same origin.
Send the origin (scheme, host, and port) as the referrer when the destination is a same-origin HTTPS URL.
Send the origin (scheme, host, and port) as the referrer when the destination is a cross-origin HTTPS URL. (Default)
Send the full URL as the referrer.

name: rel
description: Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.

predefinedValues.description: Specifies an alternate version of the document, such as a translated version or a version with different content.
Specifies the author of the document.
Specifies a bookmark within the document.
Specifies the canonical URL for the document, which helps search engines to eliminate duplicate content.
Specifies that the browser should preemptively perform DNS resolution for the target resource's origin.
Specifies an external document, such as a document hosted on a different website.
Specifies that the browser should preemptively perform resource loading for the target resource.
Specifies a help document that provides additional information or instructions.
Specifies an icon for the document.
Specifies a license document that contains the terms and conditions for using the current document.
Specifies the location of the document's manifest, which is a JSON file that contains metadata about the document.
Specifies the author of the document.
Specifies that the browser should preemptively perform resource loading for the target resource as a module.
Specifies the next document in a sequence, such as the next page in a book or the next step in a tutorial.
Specifies that search engines should not follow the link and should not consider it for ranking purposes.
Specifies that the browser should not send a HTTP referer header and should not allow the new browsing context to access the window.opener property, providing more security.
Specifies that the browser should not send a HTTP referer header if the user follows the element, providing more privacy.
Specifies that the browser should send a HTTP referer header and should allow the new browsing context to access the window.opener property.
Specifies the location of a pingback service that handles pingbacks for the document.
Specifies that the browser should preemptively connect to the target resource's origin.
Specifies that the browser should preemptively fetch and cache the target resource.
Specifies that the browser should preemptively fetch the target resource.
Specifies that the browser should preemptively render the target resource.
Specifies the previous document in a sequence, such as the previous page in a book or the previous step in a tutorial.
Specifies a privacy policy document that provides information about how the user's data is handled.
Specifies a search document that allows searching within the current document or website.
Specifies a stylesheet for the document.
Specifies a tag (keyword) for the current document, providing additional metadata or categorization.
Specifies a terms of service document that contains the terms and conditions for using the current document.

name: required
description: Indicates whether this element is required to fill out or not.

name: reversed
description: Indicates whether the list should be displayed in a descending order instead of an ascending order.

name: role
description: Defines an explicit role for an element for use by assistive technologies.

name: rows
description: Defines the number of rows in a text area.

name: rowspan
description: Defines the number of rows a table cell should span over.

name: sandbox
description: Stops a document loaded in an iframe from using certain features (such as submitting forms or opening new windows).

name: scope
description: Defines the cells that the header test (defined in the th element) relates to.

name: selected
description: Defines a value which will be selected on page load.

name: shadowrootclonable
description: Indicates whether the content of the element is clonable.

name: shadowrootdelegatesfocus
description: Indicates whether the element delegates focus.

name: shadowrootmode
description: Indicates the mode of the shadow root.

predefinedValues.description: The shadow root is open.
The shadow root is closed.

name: shape
description: Defines the shape of the area.

name: size
description: Defines the width of the element (in pixels). If the element's type attribute is text or password then it's the number of characters.

name: sizes
description: Defines the sizes of the icons for visual media.

name: slot
description: Assigns a slot in a shadow DOM shadow tree to an element.

name: span
description: Defines the number of columns a table cell should span over.

name: spellcheck
description: Indicates whether spell checking is allowed for the element.

predefinedValues.description: The element is to have its spelling and grammar checked.
The element is to have its spelling and grammar checked.
The element is to have its spelling and grammar checked.

name: src
description: The URL of the embeddable content.

name: srcdoc
description: A document to render in the iframe.

name: srclang
description: Specifies the language of the track text data (required if kind="subtitles").

name: srcset
description: One or more responsive image candidates.

name: start
description: Defines the first number if other than 1.

name: step
description: Specifies the interval between valid values in a number-based input.

name: style
description: Defines CSS styles which will override styles previously set.

name: tabindex
description: Overrides the browser's default tab order and follows the one specified instead.

name: target
description: Specifies where to open the linked document (in the case of an <a> element) or where to display the response received (in the case of a <form> element)

predefinedValues.description: Opens the linked document in a new window or tab.
Opens the linked document in the parent frame. If there is no parent, it acts as the _self value.
Opens the linked document in the same frame as it was clicked. (Default)
Opens the linked document in the topmost frame.

name: title
description: Text to be displayed in a tooltip when hovering over the element.

name: translate
description: Specify whether an element's attribute values and the values of its text node children are to be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged.

predefinedValues.description: Indicates that the element will be translated.
Indicates that the element will be translated.
Indicates that the element will not be translated.

name: type
description: Defines the type of the element.

predefinedValues.description: A button that submits the form.
A button that resets the contents of the form to default values.
A button that does nothing by default.
A push button with no default behavior.
A check box allowing single values to be selected/deselected.
A control for specifying a color.
A control for entering a date (year, month, and day, with no time).
A control for entering a date and time, with no time zone.
A field for editing an e-mail address.
A control that lets the user select a file.
A control that is not displayed but whose value is submitted to the server.
A graphical submit button.
A control for entering a month and year, with no time zone.
A control for entering a number.
A single-line text field whose value is obscured.
A radio button, allowing a single value to be selected out of multiple choices.
A control for entering a number whose exact value is not important.
A button that resets the contents of the form to default values.
A single-line text field for entering search strings.
A button that submits the form.
A control for entering a telephone number.
A single-line text field.
A control for entering a time value with no time zone.
A field for entering a URL.
A control for entering a date consisting of a week-year number and a week number.
A list of items in which the order of the items is important.
A list of items in which the order of the items is important.
A list of items in which the order of the items is important.
A list of items in which the order of the items is important.
A list of items in which the order of the items is important.
Indicates a classic script.
Indicates an import map script.
Indicates a module script.
Specifies that the target is an HTML document.
Specifies that the target is a CSS document.

name: usemap
description: Specifies an image as a client-side image map.

name: value
description: Defines a default value which will be displayed in the element on page load.

name: width
description: For the elements listed here, this establishes the element's width.

name: wrap
description: Indicates whether the text should be wrapped.

predefinedValues.description: The browser automatically inserts line breaks (CR+LF) so that each line has no more than the width of the control; the cols attribute must also be specified for this to take effect.
The browser ensures that all line breaks in the value consist of a CR+LF pair, but does not insert any additional line breaks.

name: xmlns
description: Defines the XML namespace.
